embeds.title: Knowing Skull
embeds.description:
Special Relic / All / Downfall

At the start of each combat, add a **Knowing Skull** to your hand.
*Put me down!*

embeds.title: Knowing Skull
embeds.description:
Special Skill / 0 :colorless_energy: / Colorless / Downfall

**Ethereal**.
Choose:
Souls :p_gold:: Lose 3 HP. Gain 40 (50) Souls :p_gold:.
Success: Lose 1 HP. Add a random (upgraded) Colorless card to your hand.
A Pick Me Up: Lose 5 (2) HP. Gain a random Potion.
**Exhaust**.

jk I don't like toolbox : )
Knowing Skull once offered me two shillings for my soul.
but yeah knowing skull is super versatile as long as you have the means to deal with spending your hp consistently

lol hey bot
Are you sentient?
Ocean is merely using the bot as a puppet
money money free money
pick money get money use money
if you arent starving for hp then this is rly good
because money (and like, a potion if you have none)
but primarily money

this relic is cracked. It costs a lot of health to acquire and keep using but this giving you 40 gold a floor alone is already nuts. It can even give you a potion if you really need one and in hard fights you can get a free colourless card for only 1 HP letting the relic be relevant even in the end game, basically acting as a toolbox then.
most characters don't have much issues running this as long as your willing to potentially give up an upgrade healing

slime boss self heals, hexaghost can use this relic several times with nightmare visions and has 2rd seal. Guardian and Champ have high max HP.  Snecko can sometimes heal and can use off class synergies off the colourless card; so your usually valuing the skull for that. Collector has temporary HP to play this for free. Automation has extremely powerful self healing if you can find repair but otherwise can struggle to spam this.  Gremlins don't take the full damage from picking up the skull but will have to pay a lot to play its cards; fortunately they have easy access to temporary HP
automaton is the least likely to want this, followed by hexaghost but they can still have ways to fully abuse this and of course having a good healing relic makes that trivial.

I'm taking this event every time I see it, this is a lot more powerful then other take damage for relic events because you always know that you are getting a skull  AND that skull has multiple functions.
I think you mean <First Seal>

messages.content:
Somewhat similar to the cursed tome event from base game, pay a lot of life now (if on high ascension) in order to get access to a very valuable tool for the rest of the run. One element that I think is important to remember is that you don't have to cast the card knowing skull at all if you can't afford to lose more hp at the moment, it's totally optional. If you are in a spot where you feel you can get a bit greedy, you're free to meta scale by grabbing potions or souls, but you also can just let this go with the ethereal, or only take a very small hit to grab the colorless card, making it into a very watered down version of bag of preparation. Bag is such a strong relic though, that even a watered down version of it is still quite good, especially when it's this flexible. Almost anything that makes your turn 1's stronger is going to be great because every single fight has a turn 1.

Finding this event is usually very strong, as long as you can afford to lose the hp or have a campfire coming up soon to rest at to recover the lost health. The metascaling it offers can easily offset the temporary power trough, and if you have/find some sustain, then you can stockpile a lot of souls with this and have very powerful shops. Slime boss probably makes the best use of it due to their starting relic and several strong sustain cards in their pool, but it's very good on basically anyone. Pretty nice with dead branch, ink bottle and letter opener since you're getting a 0 cost skill in your starting hand.

I think the an often overlooked of this event is that once you take it, you can simply not play the knowing skull card and it costs 0 HP. So you're paying a tiny bit of hp at the event to allow yourself to spend more HP later for resources at an extremely high rate. You can get paid 13.33(16.66) souls per hp, 5(2) per potion, and 1 per colorless card. 1 hp to 13.3 souls is an insane exchange rate. Correct me if I'm wrong, but the base game's world of goop, the base game's face trader, and the base game knowing skull events are the only ones that directly allow you to trade HP for Gold/Souls. The world of goop event lets you trade 1 HP for 6.8 gold, and face trader 1 hp for 12.5 (8.3 on higher ascensions). Base game's knowing skull lets you trade one time (and then leave) for a rate of 1 HP for 6.9 gold, a second time would be 1 HP to 6.6 gold, a third is 7.7 gold. This card is so much better of an exchange rate, and the option can be picked many many times.

Basically the way it works is you spend 7(14) HP to then allow yourself to convert your HP to other resources (1 HP to 13.3(16.6) souls, 5(2) HP to potion, 1 HP to a colorless card for the fight, or 0 HP for nothing) however these rates are just way too high, resulting in this just being extremely strong. Your HP is a resource and this is the best way to convert it into a more tradition resource (souls) while also being the most versatile.
The way I'd advise balancing it is the same way the base game did. Once you pick an option, the HP cost for it is +1 permanently. It may also need a slight nerf to the souls option, not sure.
